userPrompt: Create an n8n workflow that receives customer support tickets via webhook, uses an AI agent to categorize the urgency and sentiment, automatically assigns tickets to the right team based on keywords, and sends Slack notifications with different priority levels. Include retry logic and error handling

logs.message:
Parameters: {"nodeType":"nodes-langchain.agent","config":{"text":"{{$json.ticket_content || $json.description || $json.message}}","outputType":"output","systemMessage":"You are a customer support ticket analysis assistant. Analyze the provided ticket content and return a JSON response with the following structure:

{
  "urgency": "low|medium|high|critical",
  "sentiment": "positive|neutral|negative",
  "keywords": ["keyword1", "keyword2"],
  "category": "technical|billing|general|bug|feature_request",
  "reasoning": "Brief explanation of the classification"
}

Classification guidelines:
- CRITICAL: System down, security issues, data loss
- HIGH: Major functionality broken, multiple users affected
- MEDIUM: Single user issues, minor bugs, feature requests
- LOW: Questions, documentation requests, general inquiries

Extract relevant keywords that could help with team assignment (e.g., "payment", "login", "API", "mobile", "database")."}}
Added node: nodes-base.webhook (Webhook that gracefully handles processing errors)
Added node: nodes-base.code (Transform data structure using JavaScript)
Added node: nodes-base.slack (Send a message to Slack channel)
Added node: nodes-langchain.agent (Create an AI agent that can use tools)
Added node: nodes-base.httpRequest (Examples of modern error handling using onError property)
Added node: nodes-base.switch (Route support tickets to different teams based on keywords and categorization results)

parameters.text: {{$json.ticket_content || $json.description || $json.message}}
parameters.systemMessage:
You are a customer support ticket analysis assistant. Analyze the provided ticket content and return a JSON response with the following structure:

{
  "urgency": "low|medium|high|critical",
  "sentiment": "positive|neutral|negative",
  "keywords": ["keyword1", "keyword2"],
  "category": "technical|billing|general|bug|feature_request",
  "reasoning": "Brief explanation of the classification"
}

Classification guidelines:
- CRITICAL: System down, security issues, data loss
- HIGH: Major functionality broken, multiple users affected
- MEDIUM: Single user issues, minor bugs, feature requests
- LOW: Questions, documentation requests, general inquiries

Extract relevant keywords that could help with team assignment (e.g., "payment", "login", "API", "mobile", "database").

nodes.purpose: Examples of modern error handling using onError property

configuration.notes: HTTP Request node for sending Slack notifications with priority-based formatting and retry logic for customer support ticket workflow

nodes.purpose: Route support tickets to different teams based on keywords and categorization results

configuration.notes: Routes support tickets to appropriate teams based on AI categorization and keywords

state.userPrompt: Create an n8n workflow that receives customer support tickets via webhook, uses an AI agent to categorize the urgency and sentiment, automatically assigns tickets to the right team based on keywords, and sends Slack notifications with different priority levels. Create an AI agent that can use tools

workflow.name: Customer Support Ticket Processing with AI Categorization

parameters.text:
You are a customer support ticket analyzer. Analyze the following ticket and provide:
1. Urgency level (low/medium/high/critical)
2. Sentiment (positive/neutral/negative)
3. Brief reasoning

Ticket: {{ $json.subject }} - {{ $json.description }}

buildPhases.description: Webhook endpoint receives incoming customer support tickets via HTTP POST requests. Configured with error handling to gracefully process tickets and stop workflow execution if critical errors occur.
AI agent analyzes ticket content to categorize urgency levels and sentiment, providing structured output for automated routing decisions. Continues workflow execution even if AI analysis fails.
JavaScript code transforms ticket data, applies team assignment logic based on keywords and AI categorization, and prepares structured data for routing and notifications.
Switch node routes processed tickets to appropriate team channels based on assigned team values from the data processor, enabling targeted notifications.

Primary Slack notification sends formatted ticket details to team-specific channels with priority-based formatting. Backup HTTP request provides redundant notification delivery with retry logic and error handling.

node.purpose: Webhook that gracefully handles processing errors
Transform data structure using JavaScript
Send a message to Slack channel
Create an AI agent that can use tools
Examples of modern error handling using onError property
Route support tickets to different teams based on keywords and categorization results

config.notes: Webhook endpoint for receiving customer support tickets. Configured with error handling to gracefully process incoming tickets and continue workflow execution even if downstream processing fails.

operationHistory.purpose: Webhook that gracefully handles processing errors
operationHistory.reasoning: Customized the webhook path from 'resilient-webhook' to 'support-tickets' to clearly indicate this endpoint receives customer support tickets

config.notes: Transform webhook ticket data and add team assignment logic based on keywords and AI categorization

operationHistory.purpose: Transform data structure using JavaScript
operationHistory.reasoning: Customized the template's generic data transformation to specifically handle customer support ticket processing

config.notes: Send Slack notifications for customer support tickets with priority-based formatting and team mentions

operationHistory.purpose: Send a message to Slack channel
operationHistory.reasoning: Customized the template to handle customer support ticket notifications with dynamic priority levels

config.notes: AI agent that analyzes customer support tickets to categorize urgency (low/medium/high/critical) and sentiment (positive/neutral/negative) for automated routing and prioritization

parameters.text: {{$json.ticket_content || $json.description || $json.message}}
parameters.systemMessage:
You are a customer support ticket analysis assistant. Analyze the provided ticket content and return a JSON response with the following structure:

{
  "urgency": "low|medium|high|critical",
  "sentiment": "positive|neutral|negative",
  "keywords": ["keyword1", "keyword2"],
  "category": "technical|billing|general|bug|feature_request",
  "reasoning": "Brief explanation of the classification"
}

Classification guidelines:
- CRITICAL: System down, security issues, data loss
- HIGH: Major functionality broken, multiple users affected
- MEDIUM: Single user issues, minor bugs, feature requests
- LOW: Questions, documentation requests, general inquiries

Extract relevant keywords that could help with team assignment (e.g., "payment", "login", "API", "mobile", "database").

operationHistory.purpose: Create an AI agent that can use tools

phases.description: Webhook endpoint receives incoming customer support tickets via HTTP POST requests. Configured with error handling to gracefully process tickets and stop workflow execution if critical errors occur.
AI agent analyzes ticket content to categorize urgency levels and sentiment, providing structured output for automated routing decisions. Continues workflow execution even if AI analysis fails.
JavaScript code transforms ticket data, applies team assignment logic based on keywords and AI categorization, and prepares structured data for routing and notifications.
Switch node routes processed tickets to appropriate team channels based on assigned team values from the data processor, enabling targeted notifications.

Primary Slack notification sends formatted ticket details to team-specific channels with priority-based formatting. Backup HTTP request provides redundant notification delivery with retry logic and error handling.

new.userPrompt: Create an n8n workflow that receives customer support tickets via webhook, uses an AI agent to categorize the urgency and sentiment, automatically assigns tickets to the right team based on keywords, and sends Slack notifications with different priority levels. Include retry logic and error handling

workflow.name: Customer Support Ticket Processing with AI Categorization

parameters.text:
{{ `You are a customer support ticket analyzer. Analyze the following ticket and provide:

Ticket: ${$json.subject} - ${$json.description}` }}

parameters.content:
## 游닌 Triggers
Webhook endpoint receives incoming customer support tickets via HTTP POST requests. Configured with error handling to gracefully process tickets and stop workflow execution if critical errors occur.

## 丘뙖잺 Transform
AI agent analyzes ticket content to categorize urgency levels and sentiment, providing structured output for automated routing decisions. Continues workflow execution even if AI analysis fails.

JavaScript code transforms ticket data, applies team assignment logic based on keywords and AI categorization, and prepares structured data for routing and notifications.

## 游 Outputs
Switch node routes processed tickets to appropriate team channels based on assigned team values from the data processor, enabling targeted notifications.

Primary Slack notification sends formatted ticket details to team-specific channels with priority-based formatting. Backup HTTP request provides redundant notification delivery with retry logic and error handling.

JavaScript code transforms ticket data, applies team assignment logic based on keywords and AI categorization, and prepares structured data for routing and notifications.
Switch node routes processed tickets to appropriate team channels based on assigned team values from the data processor, enabling targeted notifications.

Primary Slack notification sends formatted ticket details to team-specific channels with priority-based formatting. Backup HTTP request provides redundant notification delivery with retry logic and error handling.
